<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Project Manager - Transportation/Civil Engineering

Location: Jacksonville, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Engineering, Project Management

Description:
Senior Transportation Project Manager  
Hanson Professional Services Inc. is seeking a candidate to fill a full-time Senior Transportation Project Manager position in our Jacksonville, FL office.
Location - Jacksonville, Fl (relocation assistance provided)
Position Profile: 
As the Senior Transportation Project Manager, you will be a part of multidisciplinary teams to plan, oversee, guide, and mentor staff and interface with the Florida Infrastructure Group to produce and execute the various deliverables required as part of our infrastructure practice, as well as, in support to other Hanson markets.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate experience with FDOT, Transportation plans and standards (transportation, stormwater, utilities), and related discipline projects.Typical responsibilities include managing subordinate engineering support staff on multiple project teams, possessing practical project accounting knowledge, and producing high-quality products within budget.Emphasis in Florida Department of Transportation (FDOT), municipal engineering and local government is preferred. This role will require a combination of resource and client management, technical production, and staff supervision and development.Projects are likely to include reconstruction of rural highways and roads, urban highways and streets, major urban thoroughfares, culverts and storm sewer, intersections, sidewalks and multiuse paths, rail grade crossings, signing, pavement marking, and traffic control plans for construction.This role will function equally effectively in both client-facing and internal-facing circumstances.
A Day in the Life of a Senior Project Manager:
Day-to-day task oversight providing direction and supervision to junior level staff in the areas of roadway engineering design/analysis and plans/construction contract documents.Author technical documents such as engineering reports, specifications, and special provisions.Prepare and review complex engineering calculations.Perform construction administration duties which include submittal review, evaluating construction progress for compliance with contract documents, and the direction of engineering support personnel and subconsultants.Work with local governments and DOTs to deliver projects.Develop scope and staff hours for related tasks.Attend and/or facilitate meetings with current and future clients.Conduct site investigations, including determining problems, identifying alternative solutions, and providing recommendations.Interact with clients to discuss existing and future projects.Interface with leadership to assess performance.Prepare responses to requests for proposals, attend project pursuit interviews and other related marketing activities for business development.Other duties as assigned.

Essential skill sets to succeed:

Technical Skills:Clear understanding of transportation design applications and software including Microstation and Open Roads Designer.Experience as engineer of record on transportation studies and design projects.Experience working with municipalities, counties, FDOT, water management districts and municipal utility districts.Experience interacting with other peer disciplines including but not limited to roadways, mechanical, electrical, plumbing, architectural and structural.

Soft Skills:Ability to communicate complex technical concepts both visually and in text, to engineers, clients, and public stakeholders.Must be able to build effective relationships with internal and external client bases and work with and manage project staff.Must be able to work independently and as a team member to problem solve and learn new technical skills.Manage and mentor junior technical staff.Must be able to collaborate remotely with colleagues in other offices.Work assignment flexibility including being available to travel for out-of-town assignments, primarily daytrips or evening attendance of local client meetings.Hours worked will vary based on project demands, including occasional, periodic overtime.

Education/Experience:A bachelor’s degree in civil engineering.Minimum of 15 years of progressive Transportation engineering experience.At minimum, possess an active Professional Engineers license in Florida or the ability to obtain it within six (6) months.Master’s degree in civil engineering, transportation engineering, or an MBA is preferred.Participation with technical society organizations a plus.
Benefits - Our focus on people means we offer a generous benefits program to help you create a solid foundation for health and security throughout your career, including:
Competitive compensationPerformance bonuses401(k) with matching contributionEmployee Stock Ownership PlanComprehensive health & well-being plansFinancial wellness plansWork-life balance programs
Want to know more? Visit our benefits page for all the details.
Culture - We understand that selecting a job is about more than the day-to-day tasks. It’s important to feel like you belong and safe to grow and progress along your career path. You’ll find that at Hanson. We have an inclusive, diverse workforce awaiting to connect with you and numerous opportunities to cultivate your career, including:
Monthly educational webinarsLeadership trainingLunch & learn development sessions24/7 access to thousands of skill-building coursesMentorship opportunitiesAward-winning internship programEmployee recognitionAnd so much more!
As employers/governmental contractors, we comply with government regulations, including affirmative action responsibilities where they apply. To assist us in meeting our affirmative action goals, employees are encouraged to refer minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY — AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYEREEO / MINORITY / FEMALE / INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES / VETERANWe do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or agencies/staffing firms. Resumes are only accepted from recruiters and agency/staffing firms if a signed agreement is in place at the inception of the recruiting effort and authorized for a specified position.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
